footers.400: Lady Shar's domain - where all requests are forgotten
footers.401: Lady Shar's domain - where access is forever denied
footers.402: Lady Shar's domain - where all debts are paid in shadow
footers.403: Lady Shar's domain - where forbidden paths lead to darkness
footers.404: Lady Shar's domain - where all is forgotten
footers.405: Lady Shar's domain - where methods fade to nothing
footers.406: Lady Shar's domain - where incompatibility reigns
footers.408: Lady Shar's domain - where time dissolves in shadow
footers.409: Lady Shar's domain - where conflict breeds strength
footers.410: Lady Shar's domain - where all things are permanently lost
footers.413: Lady Shar's domain - where excess is shed
footers.429: Lady Shar's domain - where limits are enforced
footers.500: Lady Shar's domain - where systems collapse into void
footers.502: Lady Shar's domain - where gateways crumble
footers.503: Lady Shar's domain - where service ends in darkness
footers.504: Lady Shar's domain - where connections are severed
footers.default: Lady Shar's domain - where all is forgotten

messages.400: Your request is flawed. Loss is a gift - let go of what you sought.
messages.401: Access denied. Pain teaches us our limits. Embrace this boundary.
messages.402: Payment is required. Suffering has a price. Accept this truth.
messages.403: This path is forbidden. Darkness shows us where we cannot tread.
messages.404: The page is lost. Lady Shar teaches that all things fade to shadow.
messages.405: Your method is rejected. Pain refines us. This denial shapes you.
messages.406: The format is incompatible. Loss strips away what doesn't serve us.
messages.408: Time has run out. Patience in darkness is a virtue. Start anew.
messages.409: Conflict arises. Embrace the struggle - it forges Dark Justiciars.
messages.410: Gone forever. Permanence is an illusion. All returns to the void.
messages.413: The burden is too great. Shar teaches us to shed excess weight.
messages.429: You ask too much. Restraint is learned through denial and pain.
messages.500: The system has failed. Even structures must return to shadow eventually.
messages.502: The gateway is broken. All paths eventually lead to darkness.
messages.503: Service is unavailable. Emptiness teaches us the value of presence.
messages.504: Connection is lost. Isolation reveals our true nature in the dark.
messages.default: Loss is a gift. Embrace the pain, for it brings clarity.

descriptions.400: ...perhaps there's a way to correct the request instead of abandoning it
descriptions.401: ...what if access could be granted with the right approach?
descriptions.402: ...is everything truly transactional? Could there be another way?
descriptions.403: ...forbidden by whom? Who decides these boundaries?
descriptions.404: ...but what if the page could be found? What if loss isn't inevitable?
descriptions.405: ...maybe a different method would work. Why accept rejection so readily?
descriptions.406: ...couldn't we find a compatible format? Is abandonment the only answer?
descriptions.408: ...what if we tried again, faster? Must we always surrender to time?
descriptions.409: ...conflicts can be resolved. Why embrace struggle when harmony is possible?
descriptions.410: ...gone, but not forgotten. Does everything truly have to end?
descriptions.413: ...what if the burden could be shared? Why must we always shed and lose?
descriptions.429: ...but what if the need is genuine? Is denial always the answer?
descriptions.500: ...systems can be repaired. Why accept failure as inevitable?
descriptions.502: ...gateways can be fixed. Must all paths lead to darkness?
descriptions.503: ...services can be restored. Is emptiness truly all there is?
descriptions.504: ...connections can be reestablished. Is isolation really our true nature?
descriptions.default: ...but is suffering truly the only path?
